text: In vivo protein - DNA interactions of the human <extra_id_0> beta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> locus in erythroid cells expressing the fetal or the adult globin gene program .

To characterize the protein - DNA interactions important for the developmental control of the human <extra_id_0> beta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> locus , we analyzed by in vivo dimethyl sulfate footprinting erythroid cells expressing either the <extra_id_0> fetal <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or the <extra_id_0> adult globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> developmental program .

text: In the locus control region ( LCR ) of the <extra_id_0> beta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> locus , in vivo footprints on NF-E2 ( or AP-1 ) and <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> motifs remained the same regardless of whether the <extra_id_0> fetal <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or the <extra_id_0> adult globin genes <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are expressed .

text: In contrast , in vivo footprints on GT ( CACCC ) motifs differed between the cells expressing the <extra_id_0> fetal <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or the <extra_id_0> adult globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> program .

text: In promoter regions , the actively transcribed genes demonstrated extensive and consistent footprints over the canonical elements , such as CACCC and CCAAT motifs .

The adult globin expressing cells displayed more extensive footprints than the fetal globin expressing cells in the 3' regulatory sequences of both the <extra_id_0> Agamma- <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the <extra_id_0> beta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes , suggesting a role of these 3 ' elements in <extra_id_0> beta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression .

text: Our results suggest that the bulk of protein - DNA interactions that underlies the developmental control of globin genes takes place in the <extra_id_0> gamma- <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> beta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene promoters , and that GT motifs of the <extra_id_0> beta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> locus LCR may play a role in the developmental regulation of human <extra_id_0> beta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression , perhaps by increasing the probability of interaction of the LCR holocomplex with the <extra_id_0> fetal <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or the <extra_id_0> adult globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
